articles.headline: Marketers of Plavix Outfoxed on a Deal
articles.snippet: Generic drug maker Apotex on Tuesday began shipping a cheaper form of Plavix, the best-selling anticlotting agent marketed by Sanofi-Aventis and Bristol-Myers Squibb.
articles.abstract: Generic drug maker Apotex on Tuesday began shipping a cheaper form of Plavix, the best-selling anticlotting agent marketed by Sanofi-Aventis and Bristol-Myers Squibb.
articles.lead_paragraph: The generic drug maker Apotex yesterday began shipping a cheaper form of Plavix, the anticlotting agent that is one of the world’s best-selling drugs, in an embarrassing setback for the drug’s brand-name marketers, Sanofi-Aventis and Bristol-Myers Squibb.

articles.headline: A Bank for Every Block
articles.snippet: Big banks have been building branches to try to grab and hold onto customers, but the push may be nearing its end.
articles.abstract: Big banks have been building branches to try to grab and hold onto customers, but the push may be nearing its end.

articles.headline: Cablevision to Restate Its Earnings
articles.snippet: Cablevision Systems has joined the growing ranks of companies restating earnings because of questions about the timing of stock option grants.
articles.abstract: Cablevision Systems has joined the growing ranks of companies restating earnings because of questions about the timing of stock option grants.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cablevision Systems, the nation’s third-largest cable operator, has joined the growing ranks of companies that have announced plans to restate earnings because of questions about the timing of stock option grants.

articles.headline: Left or Right, Israelis Are Pro-War
articles.snippet: The harder the war with Hezbollah becomes, the more the Israeli public wants it to proceed, and with greater force.
articles.abstract: The harder the war with Hezbollah becomes, the more the Israeli public wants it to proceed, and with greater force.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, Aug. 8 — As Israel’s war with Hezbollah finishes a fourth difficult week, domestic criticism of its prosecution is growing. Yet there is a paradoxical effect as well: the harder the war has been, the more the public wants it to proceed.

articles.headline: A Face Is Exposed for AOL Searcher No. 4417749
articles.snippet: Detailed records of searches underscore how much people reveal about themselves when they use search engines.
articles.abstract: Detailed records of searches underscore how much people reveal about themselves when they use search engines.
articles.lead_paragraph: Buried in a list of 20 million Web search queries collected by AOL and recently released on the Internet is user No. 4417749. The number was assigned by the company to protect the searcher’s anonymity, but it was not much of a shield.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Tom Zeller Jr

articles.headline: On Amazon, All of a Sudden Everyone’s a Milk Critic
articles.snippet: An Internet call to submit reviews on Amazon.com of a $3.99 gallon of Tuscan-brand whole milk generated hundreds of responses.
articles.abstract: An Internet call to submit reviews on Amazon.com of a $3.99 gallon of Tuscan-brand whole milk generated hundreds of responses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Few sites have given customer product reviews more prominence than Amazon.com. But how much can one possibly say about ... milk?

articles.headline: Anti-U.S. Feeling Leaves Arab Reformers Isolated
articles.snippet: Moderate Arab reformers say that U.S. support for Israel’s battle with Hezbollah has put them on the defensive.
articles.abstract: Moderate Arab reformers say that U.S. support for Israel’s battle with Hezbollah has put them on the defensive.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAMASCUS, Syria, Aug. 8 — Moderate reformers across the Arab world say American support for Israel’s battle with Hezbollah has put them on the defensive, tarring them by association and boosting Islamist parties.

articles.headline: In Policy Shift, Fed Calls a Halt to Raising Rates
articles.snippet: In the statement announcing the decision, the central bank predicted that slower growth will curb inflation.
articles.abstract: In the statement announcing the decision, the central bank predicted that slower growth will curb inflation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 — The Federal Reserve on Tuesday suspended its two-year campaign of raising interest rates, a long-awaited policy shift based on the hope that a modest economic slowdown will subdue inflation without much pain.

articles.headline: The Heroes of Housing Just Say No
articles.snippet: In an age of giving mortgages to anyone who wants one, there is one small sliver of the real estate market that has kept its wits and can serve as a model.
articles.abstract: In an age of giving mortgages to anyone who wants one, there is one small sliver of the real estate market that has kept its wits and can serve as a model.

articles.headline: A Face Is Exposed for AOL Searcher No. 4417749
articles.snippet: Buried in a list of 20 million Web search queries collected by AOL and recently released on the Internet is user No. 4417749. The number was assigned by the company to protect the searcher's anonymity, but it was not much of a shield.      No. 441...
articles.abstract: Buried in a list of 20 million Web search queries collected by AOL and recently released on the Internet is user No. 4417749. The number was assigned by the company to protect the searcher's anonymity, but it was not much of a shield.      No. 4417749 conducted hundreds of searches over a three-month period on topics ranging from ''numb fingers'' to ''60 single men'' to ''dog that urinates on everything.''
articles.lead_paragraph: Buried in a list of 20 million Web search queries collected by AOL and recently released on the Internet is user No. 4417749. The number was assigned by the company to protect the searcher's anonymity, but it was not much of a shield.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Tom Zeller Jr

articles.headline: On Amazon, All of a Sudden Everyones a Milk Critic
articles.snippet: Few sites have given customer product reviews more prominence than Amazon.com. But how much can one possibly say about  milk?     Apparently a fair bit -- particularly if the aim is to subvert the spirit of customer reviews in the service of Inter...
articles.abstract: Few sites have given customer product reviews more prominence than Amazon.com. But how much can one possibly say about  milk?     Apparently a fair bit -- particularly if the aim is to subvert the spirit of customer reviews in the service of Internet high jinks. Such appears to be the explanation behind hundreds of reviews at Amazon for a $3.99 gallon of Tuscan-brand whole milk.
articles.lead_paragraph: Few sites have given customer product reviews more prominence than Amazon.com. But how much can one possibly say about milk?

articles.headline: Left or Right, Israelis Are Pro-War
articles.snippet: As Israel's war with Hezbollah finishes a fourth difficult week, domestic criticism of its prosecution is growing. Yet there is a paradoxical effect as well: the harder the war has been, the more the public wants it to proceed.      The criticism ...
articles.abstract: As Israel's war with Hezbollah finishes a fourth difficult week, domestic criticism of its prosecution is growing. Yet there is a paradoxical effect as well: the harder the war has been, the more the public wants it to proceed.      The criticism is not that the war is going on, but that it is going poorly. The public wants the army to hit Hezbollah harder, so it will not threaten Israel again.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, Aug. 8 - As Israel's war with Hezbollah finishes a fourth difficult week, domestic criticism of its prosecution is growing. Yet there is a paradoxical effect as well: the harder the war has been, the more the public wants it to proceed.

articles.headline: The Heroes of Housing Just Say No
articles.snippet: THERE'S an old ''Saturday Night Live'' skit in which Eddie Murphy sets out to experience life as a white man in New York. He starts in a dressing room, where makeup artists lighten his skin as he studies up by reading Hallmark cards. Duly prepared...
articles.abstract: THERE'S an old ''Saturday Night Live'' skit in which Eddie Murphy sets out to experience life as a white man in New York. He starts in a dressing room, where makeup artists lighten his skin as he studies up by reading Hallmark cards. Duly prepared, he wades into Midtown Manhattan calling himself Mr. White.     His first stop is a newsstand, where the white cashier conspiratorially tells him to take a newspaper without paying for it. Then comes a ride on a public bus that morphs into a lounge with cocktails and music after the last black rider gets off.

articles.headline: Signs of an Escalation by Israel
articles.snippet: Israeli soldiers fought Hezbollah guerrillas on the border with Lebanon amid signs that Israel was preparing a major escalation. Page A11.
articles.abstract: Israeli soldiers fought Hezbollah guerrillas on the border with Lebanon amid signs that Israel was preparing a major escalation. Page A11.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israeli soldiers fought Hezbollah guerrillas on the border with Lebanon amid signs that Israel was preparing a major escalation. Page A11.

articles.headline: In Policy Shift, Fed Calls a Halt to Raising Rates
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve on Tuesday suspended its two-year campaign of raising interest rates, a long-awaited policy shift based on the hope that a modest economic slowdown will subdue inflation without much pain.     After 17 consecutive increases at ...
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve on Tuesday suspended its two-year campaign of raising interest rates, a long-awaited policy shift based on the hope that a modest economic slowdown will subdue inflation without much pain.     After 17 consecutive increases at each meeting since June 2004, the central bank voted to hold its benchmark interest rate steady at 5.25 percent. Policy makers suggested that they wanted more time to see where the economy was headed before deciding whether further increases might be necessary.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 - The Federal Reserve on Tuesday suspended its two-year campaign of raising interest rates, a long-awaited policy shift based on the hope that a modest economic slowdown will subdue inflation without much pain.

articles.headline: A Bank for Every Block
articles.snippet: At the intersection of 32nd Street and Park Avenue in Manhattan, a Citibank branch sits on the northeast corner. A Commerce Bancorp branch is across the street. A North Fork bank stands over the southwest side. And taking up the fourth corner spot...
articles.abstract: At the intersection of 32nd Street and Park Avenue in Manhattan, a Citibank branch sits on the northeast corner. A Commerce Bancorp branch is across the street. A North Fork bank stands over the southwest side. And taking up the fourth corner spot: a new branch for J. P. Morgan Chase, which is not more than a short sprint from an HSBC banking center up the block.      Too many bank branches? Maybe.

articles.headline: Marketers of Plavix Outfoxed on a Deal
articles.snippet: The generic drug maker Apotex yesterday began shipping a cheaper form of Plavix, the anticlotting agent that is one of the world's best-selling drugs, in an embarrassing setback for the drug's brand-name marketers, Sanofi-Aventis and Bristol-Myers...
articles.abstract: The generic drug maker Apotex yesterday began shipping a cheaper form of Plavix, the anticlotting agent that is one of the world's best-selling drugs, in an embarrassing setback for the drug's brand-name marketers, Sanofi-Aventis and Bristol-Myers Squibb.     A year ago, analysts had predicted that the companies had a better than 60 percent chance of winning a patent dispute with Apotex. But an attempt by the companies to settle the dispute has backfired, opening the way for Apotex to enter the market.
articles.lead_paragraph: The generic drug maker Apotex yesterday began shipping a cheaper form of Plavix, the anticlotting agent that is one of the world's best-selling drugs, in an embarrassing setback for the drug's brand-name marketers, Sanofi-Aventis and Bristol-Myers Squibb.

articles.headline: Cablevision to Restate Its Earnings
articles.snippet: Cablevision Systems, the nation's third-largest cable operator, has joined the growing ranks of companies that have announced plans to restate earnings because of questions about the timing of stock option grants.     Cablevision, based in Bethpag...
articles.abstract: Cablevision Systems, the nation's third-largest cable operator, has joined the growing ranks of companies that have announced plans to restate earnings because of questions about the timing of stock option grants.     Cablevision, based in Bethpage, N.Y., is controlled by the Dolan family, which also owns Madison Square Garden. The company said yesterday that a voluntary review of stock option grants and stock appreciation rights had revealed that a number of grants from 1997 to 2002 carried dates that did not match the actual dates they were granted. The company said it expected financial results for those years would have to be restated.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cablevision Systems, the nation's third-largest cable operator, has joined the growing ranks of companies that have announced plans to restate earnings because of questions about the timing of stock option grants.

articles.headline: Anti-U.S. Feeling Leaves Arab Reformers Isolated
articles.snippet: Moderate reformers across the Arab world say American support for Israel's battle with Hezbollah has put them on the defensive, tarring them by association and boosting Islamist parties.      The very people whom the United States wanted to encour...
articles.abstract: Moderate reformers across the Arab world say American support for Israel's battle with Hezbollah has put them on the defensive, tarring them by association and boosting Islamist parties.      The very people whom the United States wanted to encourage to promote democracy from Bahrain to Casablanca instead feel trapped by a policy that they now ridicule more or less as ''destroying the region in order to save it.''
articles.lead_paragraph: DAMASCUS, Syria, Aug. 8 - Moderate reformers across the Arab world say American support for Israel's battle with Hezbollah has put them on the defensive, tarring them by association and boosting Islamist parties.
